title: Provides a toll exemption for certain ambulance services
summary: Exempts ambulance services from tolls on any highway, bridge, tunnel or other toll on toll roads within the state at any time.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2372

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  SEWARD,  BONACIC, LARKIN, MAZIARZ, RANZENHOFER --
         read twice and ordered printed, and when printed to  be  committed  to
         the Committee on Transportation

       AN  ACT  in  relation  to  exempting certain ambulance services from the
         payment of tolls

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary,
    2  the  payment  of tolls on any highway, bridge, tunnel or other toll road
    3  within the state shall not apply to an ambulance service as  defined  in
    4  subdivision  two  of section three thousand one of the public health law
    5  or a voluntary ambulance service as defined in subdivision three of such
    6  section, regardless of whether or not such vehicles are responding to an
    7  emergency.
    8    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05835-01-1
actClause: AN ACT in relation to exempting certain ambulance services from the payment of tolls
